Award.AwardTitle: NSF Student Travel Grant for 2019 IEEE International Conference on Sensing, Communication and Networking (IEEE SECON)

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Computer & Info Scie & Enginr

Division.LongName: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

Award.AbstractNarration:
This project will enable up to 7 students from educational institutions in the US to attend the Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE) Communications Society Conference on Sensing, Communication, and Networking (SECON) conference - SECON 2019, to be held in Boston June 10 - 13, 2019. The conference has established itself as the IEEE Communication Society's premier venue for research in sensor, mesh, ad hoc networks and cyber physical systems. This award will especially benefit students who identify as members of under-represented groups (women, minorities and people with disabilities), and students who are attending the conference for the first time, from universities not represented in the conference program.

Conference attendance is an integral part of the life of a researcher. By creating new opportunities for students, especially those from under-represented groups, to attend a high-quality conference, this project will benefit the research community in several ways. The students themselves benefit from (1) the opportunity to meet and interact with many other researchers in a favorable setting; (2) seeing research presented that may be related to what they are working on; and (3) the inspiration to pursue new directions. Leading conferences such as SECON also provide an opportunity for students to interact with industry researchers and recruiters helping pave the way for the next step in their careers. The research community benefits from the training and experience of the students in the pipeline, and the introduction of new diverse research perspectives.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The objective of this NSF Student Travel Grant is to support students from US-based institutes to travel to the IEEE SECON 2019 in Boston in June 2019, including hotel, airfare and SECON registration. The total funds available was $15,000, including $7,000 requested from NSF for IEEE SECON 2019 and $8,000 leftover from IEEE SECON 2018. 

The conference received 28 applications, which have been reviewed by the Student Travel Grant Committee, including Prof. Enrico Natalizio (University of Lorraine, Italy), Prof. Zhangyu Guan (University at Buffalo, USA) and Prof. Bala Natarajan (Kansas State University, USA) and the Advisory Committee, including Prof. Stefano Basagni (Northeastern University, USA), Prof. Tommaso Melodia (Northeastern University, USA) and Prof. Josep Jornet (University at Buffalo, USA). In total 15 applicants have been selected to receive the awards, from Auburn University, The Ohio State University, University of Kentucky, Norfolk State University, Michigan State University, Rutgers University, and University of Arizona, among others. 

Among the 28 applicants, 10 are women/under-represented applicants, including one Black-African applicant from City College of New York, one applicant from HBCU university (Norfolk State University), and 8 female applicants. Seven of these applicants have been selected to receive the awards with support of $6,450, corresponding to 43% of the total funds ($15,000). Four of the awardees were first-time attendees with total support of $3,450, corresponding to 23% of the total funds.
